title: Ticket #1849: memory leak in SecMan::CreateNonNegotiatedSecuritySession()
description:
Brian Bockelman noticed a memory leak while valgrinding the schedd. I tracked it down to the following line in SecMan::CreateNonNegotiatedSecuritySession() 

    unsigned char* keybuf = Condor_Crypt_Base::oneWayHashKey(private_key);

This buffer is passed to KeyInfo::KeyInfo(), which I thought took ownership of it, but which actually just copies the contents of the buffer and does not take ownership.

This bug affects those who turn on SEC_ENABLE_MATCH_PASSWORD_AUTHENTICATION and, since 7.5.4, any daemon that frequently starts child daemons (e.g. the schedd).
